Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 08:17AM 716bobbiejo wrote: Hi!  I had bilaterals with no reconstruction on 4/18/11.  I couldn't be more at ease with my decision.  I knew that I wasn't up for more surgeries or other complications.  I've been going "flat" ever since.  I'm about ready to be fitted for my prosthetics, which I think will be good, but I'm actually just fine with how I look.  Everyone is different, & my decision isn't what's best for everyone.  But, I wanted to share my story.  Breastfree.org was a huge part in my decision making process.
Posts.Title: No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2011 04:38PM 716bobbiejo wrote: Thanks, everyone!  I am on day #5 & so far so good.  The Leunasta pain was pretty unbearable for me, but I could still function.  I'm trying to keep life as normal for our 4 year old as I can.  He's my strength!
Posts.Title: Driving, Shopping, Etc. 716bobbiejo dlb823

Posts.Content: 716bobbiejo wrote: I'm starting A/C x 4, followed by Taxol x 4 tomorrow.  I'll be accompanied to each infusion by a family member or friend to drive me home.  My question to those of you who have already lived this is, on my "good" days, can I drive myself to the store to do the grocery shopping?  Can I be "normal" on the days that I feel up to it? Thanks!  Bobbie Jo Dx 3/16/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Driving, Shopping, Etc. 716bobbiejo dlb823

Posts.Content: 716bobbiejo wrote: I started chemo yesterday.  Was supposed to be 4 rounds of A/C followed by 4 rounds of Taxol. Well, the office did not have enough doses of A/C in house, so my treatment will be given in reverse order.  Not happy about the change, but I just need to focus on the fact that it's just a bump in the road & I'm ultimately still getting the treatment I need. I was told in the office yesterday that my hair will likely thin, but it may or may not fall out.  Any research I've done online says it will fall out.  In fact one website indicates that it will fall out in 96% of patients.  Anyone have any personal insights they'd like to share?  Thinking I was getting A/C first, my plan was to shave my head prior to the 2nd treatment (roughly 12-13 days from now).  Should I still move forward with this plan??? Thanks!  Bobbie Jo Dx 3/16/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Taxol & Hair Loss 716bobbiejo Judy_63
